tasks.title: Debug Code Audit
tasks.description: Identify and categorize all 782 print statements in the codebase.
tasks.details: Use a script or tool like `grep` or `ripgrep` to scan the codebase for `print` statements. Categorize them by file and purpose (debug, info, warning, etc.). Store results in a structured format (e.g., CSV or JSON) for tracking.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that all print statements are accurately identified and categorized by manually reviewing a sample of the results.

tasks.title: Logging Framework Setup
tasks.description: Configure Python logging with appropriate handlers and formatters.
tasks.details:
Use Python's built-in `logging` module. Configure handlers (e.g., `StreamHandler`, `FileHandler`) and formatters for structured logging. Set log levels (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR) based on the environment (development, production). Example:
```python
import logging
logging.basicConfig(
    level=logging.INFO,
    format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
    handlers=[logging.StreamHandler()]
)
```
tasks.testStrategy: Test logging output in different environments to ensure correct log levels and formats are applied.

tasks.title: Replace Debug Prints with Logging
tasks.description: Replace identified print statements with appropriate log calls.
tasks.details:
For each print statement identified in Task 1, replace it with a corresponding log call (e.g., `logging.debug`, `logging.info`). Ensure log messages are descriptive and context-rich. Example:
```python
# Before
print('Processing file:', filename)
# After
logging.info('Processing file: %s', filename)
```
tasks.testStrategy: Run the application and verify that log messages appear as expected in the configured output.

tasks.title: Remove Unnecessary Debug Code
tasks.description: Clean up debug code from production files.
tasks.details: Remove any remaining debug-specific code (e.g., commented-out prints, temporary variables) from production files. Ensure no debug artifacts remain.
tasks.testStrategy: Review a sample of cleaned files and run tests to confirm no functionality is broken.

tasks.title: Dependency Analysis
tasks.description: Review current optional dependency usage and requirements.
tasks.details: Analyze the codebase to identify where optional dependencies (PyPDF2, Pillow, pytesseract, tenacity) are needed. Document their usage and version requirements.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the analysis covers all critical use cases and dependencies.

tasks.title: Install Missing Dependencies
tasks.description: Add missing optional dependencies to pyproject.toml.
tasks.details:
Update `pyproject.toml` to include the missing dependencies with version constraints. Example:
```toml
[tool.poetry.dependencies]
PyPDF2 = "^3.0.0"
Pillow = "^9.0.0"
pytesseract = "^0.3.9"
tenacity = "^8.0.0"
```
tasks.testStrategy: Run `poetry install` and verify that dependencies are installed without conflicts.

tasks.title: Enable Advanced Features
tasks.description: Implement features enabled by new dependencies.
tasks.details: Update code to utilize the new dependencies (e.g., PDF processing with PyPDF2, image processing with Pillow). Ensure graceful degradation if dependencies are missing.
tasks.testStrategy: Test features with and without optional dependencies to verify functionality and fallback behavior.

tasks.title: Update pyproject.toml Configuration
tasks.description: Modernize pyproject.toml to current Poetry standards.
tasks.details:
Update `pyproject.toml` to comply with PEP 621 standards. Resolve deprecation warnings and ensure backward compatibility. Example:
```toml
[project]
name = "vana"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Code quality enhancement project"
```
tasks.testStrategy: Run `poetry check` to ensure no warnings or errors.

tasks.title: Add Code Quality Tools
tasks.description: Integrate linting, formatting, and type checking tools.
tasks.details:
Add tools like `flake8` (linting), `black` (formatting), and `mypy` (type checking) to the project. Configure them in `pyproject.toml` or separate config files. Example:
```toml
[tool.black]
line-length = 88
```
tasks.testStrategy: Run the tools and verify they enforce code quality standards.

tasks.title: Set Up Pre-commit Hooks
tasks.description: Automate code quality checks with pre-commit hooks.
tasks.details:
Configure pre-commit hooks to run `flake8`, `black`, and `mypy` before commits. Example `.pre-commit-config.yaml`:
```yaml
repos:
  - repo: https://github.com/psf/black
    rev: 22.3.0
    hooks:
      - id: black
```
tasks.testStrategy: Test the hooks by making a commit and verifying checks run.

tasks.title: Update Development Documentation
tasks.description: Document all changes and new processes for developers.
tasks.details: Update README and other docs to reflect new logging practices, dependency usage, and code quality tools. Include setup and usage instructions.
tasks.testStrategy: Review documentation for accuracy and completeness.

tasks.title: Comprehensive Testing
tasks.details: Run unit, integration, and performance tests to ensure no regressions. Test logging, dependency features, and code quality tools.
tasks.testStrategy: Automated and manual testing to cover all scenarios, including edge cases.
